title: Clear
description: This is to certify that the above property was inspected on ---- in accordance with the Structural Pest Control Act and rules and regulations adopted persuant thereto, and that no evidence of active infestation or infection was found in the visible and accessible areas.

title: Corrected
description: The inspection disclosed active infestation or infection in visible and accessible areas that have been corrected.

title: FHA
description: This is to certify that the property described herein is now free of evidence of active infestation or infection in the visible and accessible areas. This complies with FHA Requirements.

title: FHA/VA
description: This is to certify that the property described herein is now free of evidence of active infestation or infection in the visible and accessible areas. This complies with FHA/VA requirements.

title: GENERAL
description: This is to certify that the property described herein is now free of evidence of active infestation or infection in the visible and accessible areas.

title: Recommendations not Completed by this Company
description: as indicated on the diagram was/were not repaired by this company.  The work visibly appears completed in a workmanlike manner.  This company was not present at the time of repairs and has no knowledge of materials or quality of work performed, nor issues any warranty.

title: Standard with Exception
description: This is to certify that the property described herein is now free of evidence of active infestation or infection in the visible and accessible areas except as follows:

title: Conditional Guarantee
description: CONDITIONAL GUARANTEE: Avertapest Inc. guarantees fumigation work or localized treatment performed by this company for one year, subcontract wood repairs guaranteed 30 days. This company is not responsible for any future infestation, dry rot, or adverse conditions beyond the time of inspection. If a fumigation is performed, Avertapest Inc. is not liable for any damage to shrubs, vines, trees, etc., or any damage to roofs or roof members at the time of fumigation. In the event that a re-treatment, re-fumigation, or any other repair work is to be performed to honor a guarantee issued by Avertapest Inc., the home-owner is responsible to make the property available for any work to be performed. Avertapest Inc. will not be liable for any cost of vacating or preparing the residence for re-treatment, and/or repairs. NOTE: A new and/or extension of guarantee is never given for re-treatments done under original guarantee.  If the customer requests a whole house fumigation prior to performing wood repairs (which has has been recommended by Avertapest); wherein the customer does perform any wood repairs within 4 (four) months after the whole house fumigation; all guarantees on the fumigation work and/or termite treatment will be terminated considering excessive moisture conditions have not been corrected.

title: Pressure Treatment
description: Pressure Treatment (also known as Termite Rodding) to deliver registered termiticide product into the soil or sub slab area is recommended for the control of subterranean termites.  Avertapest will exercise extreme caution but will not be liable for damages incurred to piping while drilling through concrete.

title: Plumbing, Electrical and "Water Tightness" Clause
description: NOTE: We do not inspect or certify plumbing, plumbing fixtures, and electrical.  We do not inspect, test or certify the "water tightness" of the structure including, but not limited to - roofing, window frames, sky lights or door insulations.

title: Permit Clause
description: Note: All repair bids on this report are to repair existing structures as noted on our report. It is the responsibility of the owner of this property to inform Avertapest Inc. if some existing structure being repaired is not permitted or not built to code. It is the property owners responsibility prior to approving any repairs to check with the City Building Dept. to see if permits are required for the work estimated below. If required, the property owner will need to pull permits as an owner builder and notify Avertapest, Inc. Any additional work required by City Building Dept. and/or field inspectors will be at an additional cost.

title: Adverse Condition
description: Priming only, painting is not included in this estimate. If additional adverse conditions are uncovered during repairs, further inspection will be recommended and a supplemental report will be issued indicating any infection, or additional repairs and costs, if any.

title: Bonding
description: Repair damaged area(s) with an epoxy filler. Priming only, painting is not included in this estimate (however, we will match the primer with its original color although we cannot match completely due to weathering). If additional adverse conditions are uncovered during repairs, further inspection will be recommended and a supplemental report will be issued indicating any infection, or additional repairs and costs, if any.

title: Cellulose Debris Others to Remove
description: Contact proper tradesman to clean-out cellulose debris and remove from premises.

title: DR General
description: Replace dry-rot damaged wood members as necessary. A supplemental report will be filed should additional Damage/infestation(s)/infection(s) extend into inaccessible area(s) with recommendations and cost if any.

title: DR Window Aluminum
description: Replace rotten wood window with aluminum replacement window.

title: Deck coating weathered OTR
description: Contact proper tradesman to check deck coating for leaks and repair sub-flooring as needed. Repair and reseal deck coating.

title: Door Repair Work
description: Build frame and door to restore to code

title: Dry-rot - no roof clause
description: Replace dry-rot damaged wood members as necessary. No painting is included in this estimate. If additional adverse conditions are uncovered during repairs, further inspection will be recommended and a supplemental report will be issued indicating any infection, or additional repairs.

title: Dry-rot Window
description: Repair or replace dry-rot damaged wood window as necessary. Window will be removed and will take approximately 7 - 10 days working days to repair. No painting is included in this estimate. If additional adverse conditions are uncovered during repairs, further inspection will be recommended and a supplemental report will be issued indicating any infection, or additional repairs.

title: Dry-rot cut tips of rafters off
description: Replace dry-rot damaged wood members as neccessary. [company] is not responisible for damage to roofing material if work extends into eves. Note: Tips of some dry-rotted wood will be cut back 3" - 6" to remove damage. Note: No painting is included in this estimate.

title: Dry-rot damaged floor
description: Replace dry-rot damaged sub-flooring as required, and recover with linoleum. Note: [company] is not responsible for leaks at the toilet found during or after the repair work due to old or aged fittings.

title: Dry-rot roof or eaves
description: Replace dry-rot damaged wood members as necessary. Roofing material repairs will need to be made by a licensed tradesman after [company] has completed repair work. No painting is included in this estimate. If additional adverse conditions are uncovered during repairs, further inspection will be recommended and a supplemental report will be issued indicating any infection, or additional repairs.

title: Earth to wood contacts
description: Break earth-wood contact and or heavily treat wood members where conditions are deemed likely to lead to infestation. Low pressure "ROD" treatment, trench application or spot spray as necessary with a registered termiticide product.

title: Evidence of wood boring beetles at
description: Vacate the premises and seal the structure for fumigation with Vikane Gas at 10X Dosage. Fumigation awareness notice must be signed prior to fumigation. NO GUARANTEES OR WARRANTIES IS EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED FOR WOOD BORING BEETLES..

title: Excessive Moisture under carpet
description: Replace water damaged sub-flooring as required and recover with existing carpet.

title: Excessive moisture
description: Replace water damaged wood members to correct moisture condition.

title: Faulty Grade
description: Lower grades, and or, remove excess dirt to correct faulty grade condition. Low pressure "ROD" treatment, trench application or spot spray as necessary with a registered termiticide product.

title: Faulty grade/ deterioration
description: Lower grades, and or, remove excess dirt to correct faulty grade condition.

title: Fiberglass shower pan
description: Contact proper tradesman to replace or repair cracked shower base and / or enclosure.

title: Fume Bed Bugs
description: Vacate the premises and seal the structure for fumigation with Sulfuryl Flouride Gas at 1.9X Dosage. Fumigation awareness notice must be signed prior to fumigation. NO GUARANTEES OR WARRANTIES IS EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED FOR BED BUGS.

title: Fumigation for DW Termites
description: Vacate the premises and seal the structure for fumigation with Sulfuryl Flouride gas at a lethal dose for Drywood termites. Fumigation awareness notice must be signed prior to fumigation. Includes a two (2) year limited guarantee specific for Drywood termites only.

title: Fungus
description: Scrape and chemically treat with a registered fungucide. Patch any minor surface damage found during treatment.

title: Inaccessible areas
description: Inaccessible areas at ? due to construction and or, storage, or other condition preventing inspection.

title: Local DW
description: Chemically treat visible and accessible infestations using a registered termiticide product. Remove or cover all accessible and visible fecal pellets. Limited one year warranty specific to dry wood termites and to treated areas only.

title: Marlite
description: Replace water damaged marlite kit to correct moisture condition. Note - If damage to wall exists behind marlite kit and is found during repairs, a supplemental estimate will be given for those repairs.

title: Microwave treatment
description: Extermination of drywood termite infestation by licensed MICROWAVE treatment. Evacuation of the structure will be necessary for a period of 4 to 8 hours depending on size of the house. Treatment may include the use of Timbor (EPA reg. no. 1624-39) for further preventative measures. Remove or cover pellets.

title: OTR Excessive moisture on deck
description: Contact proper tradesman to replace moisture damaged wood members at balcony/deck flooring as necessary. Install new watertight deck coating over new material. Note - If damage is found to wood members underneath balcony which were previously inaccessible to inspect a supplemental report and estimate will be issued.

title: Others to Repair Earth to wood contacts
description: Contact proper tradesman to break earth-wood contact where conditions are deemed likely to lead to infection or infestations. Note: Possible damage to wood members could be found under dirt. If so, a re-inspection should be ordered for further recommendations.

title: Others to repair Dry-rot
description: Contact proper tradesman (or [company] will arrange or provide a Tradesman when requested) to replace dry-rot damaged wood members and correct cause of any adverse conditions. If additional adverse conditions are found during repairs, further inspection is recommended and a supplemental report indicating any infection, adverse conditions or repairs will be made.

title: Otr Dry Rot Bath Floor
description: Contact proper tradesman to replace dry-rot damaged sub-flooring as required, and recover with linoleum.

title: Otr Water Stained Ceiling
description: Contact proper tradesman to inspect for cause of water stains and correct if needed.

title: Otr termite damage
description: Others to replace damaged wood members and correct cause of any adverse conditions. If additional adverse conditions are found during repairs, further inspection is recommended and a supplemental report indicating any infection, adverse conditions or repairs will be made.

title: Pre-construction Preventative Treatment
description: Surface Treatment on exposed footings and surface soil prior to concrete slab installation.

title: Preventive treatment
description: Chemically treat with a borate bare wood components in the attic from drywood termite swarm infestation and/or fungus infection.

title: Remove Cellulose Debris
description: Clean-out cellulose debris and remove from premises.

title: Remove old pellets
description: Re-treat to insure no active infestations exist. Remove or cover accessible pellets.

title: Repair Wood
description: WOOD REPAIRS. Replace, Repair or bond and reinforce as necessary with today's available widths and grades. Priming only, painting is not included in this estimate (however, we will match the primer with its original color although we cannot match completely due to weathering). If additional adverse conditions are uncovered during repairs, further inspection will be recommended and a supplemental report will be issued indicating any infection, or additional repairs and costs, if any.

title: Repair plaster damage as necessary

title: Replace dry-rot under carpet
description: Replace dry-rot damaged sub-flooring as required and recover with existing carpet. Estimate does not include installing linoleum. Note: Avertapest Inc. is not responsible for leaks at the toilet found during or after the repair work due to old or aged fittings.

title: Replace water damaged wood members to correct moisture condition.
description: Repair and/or replace water damaged panels as necessary.

title: Secondary Recommendation
description: SECONDARY RECOMMENDATION IN LIEU OF FUMIGATION: Chemically treat visible and accessible infestations only. Remove or cover accessible pellets. This is a sub-standard recommendation due to concealed areas not being treated. Limited one year guarantee specific to dry wood termites and treated areas only. We highly recommend Avertapest's annual control service plan so that a regular inspection (and localized treatment applied as needed) can be performed on your property.

title: Secondary Treatment with Microwave System
description: SECONDARY RECOMMENDATION IN LIEU OF FUMIGATION: Extermination of dry-wood termites by licensed MICROWAVE treatment. Evacuation of structure will be necessary for a period of four to eight hours depending on the size of the house. Treatment may include the use of Timbor (EPA Reg. No. 1624-39) for further preventative measures. Remove or cover accessible pellets. Secondary work requested by ___________________.

title: Secondary treatment with Local Chemical Treatment
description: SECONDARY RECOMMENDATION IN LIEU OF FUMIGATION: Chemically treat visible and accessible infestations only. Remove or cover accessible pellets. This is a sub-standard recommendation due to concealed areas not being treated. Limited one year guarantee specific to dry wood termites and treated areas only. Secondary work requested by ___________________________.

title: Shower grout

title: Shower pan leak

Note - If during tearout of shower pan base, dry-rot is found extending into inaccessible walls, a re-inspection report will be issued with an additional estimate.

title: SubFULLperimeter
description: Low pressure "ROD" treat, trench application or low pressure spot spray with a registered termiticide product as necessary creating a continuos perimeter barrier around the structure. Break visible and accessible mud tubes. Includes a two (2) year limited guarantee specific for subterranean termites only.

title: SubLocal
description: Chemically treat using low pressure "ROD" treatment, trench application or spot treat with a registered termiticide product as necessary. Break visible and accessible mud tubes. Includes a one (1) year limited guarantee specific for subterranean termites only and treated areas only.

title: Subs treatment with tile floor
description: Pressure "ROD" treat, trench application or low pressure spot spray as necessary. Break visible and accessible sub tubes. In order to treat subterranean termites [company] must drill though grout lines between tiles and / or through tiles. [company] will not be held responsible for repair of the tile floor. There is a possibility of hitting a water line when drilling through concrete slabs, although extreme care will be taken to avoid this problem. [company] cannot be held responsible for any repair costs if this occurs.

title: What is a WDO Report
description:
What is a Wood Destroying Pest and Organism Inspection Report?

The following explains the scope and limitations of a structural pest control inspection and a Wood Destroying Pest & Organism Inspection Report.

A Wood Destroying Pest & Organism Inspection Report contains finding as to the presence or absence of wood destroying insects or organisms in visible and accessible areas on the date of inspection and contains our recommendations for correcting any infestations, infections, or conditions found. The contents of the wood destroying pest & organism inspection report are governed by the structural pest control act and its rules and regulations.

Some structures may not comply with building code requirements or may have structural, plumbing, electrical, heating and air conditioning, or other defects that do not pertain to this report. This report does not address any such defects and the water tightness of the structure as they are not within the scope of the license of the inspector or the company issuing this report.

title: Inaccessible Areas Clause
description: The following areas are considered inaccessible for purposes of inspection or are not included in a normal inspection report and therefore are excluded in this report: the interior of hollow walls; spaces between an upstairs floor and the ceiling below or a porch deck and soffit below; stall showers over finished ceilings; such structural segments as areas enclosed by bay windows, buttresses, built in cabinet work, areas under floor covering; any areas requiring the removal of storage, furnishings or appliances; any areas to which there is no access without defacing or removing lumber, masonry or finished workmanship. However, probing may be necessary during the inspection process to determine the condition of the wood.

title: Not Inspected Clause
description:
Certain areas are recognized by the industry as inaccessible and/or for other reasons not inspected. These include but are not limited to: inaccessible and/or insulated attics or portions thereof, attics with less than 18 clear crawl space, the interior of hollow walls, spaces between a floor or porch deck and the ceiling below, areas where there is no access without defacing or tearing out lumber, masonry or finished work that make inspection impractical, and areas or timbers around eaves that would require use of an extension ladder. Whole house Fumigation is a treatment effective only for Drywood Termites. Fumigation is ineffective on subterranean termites considering the fumigant will not penetrate through concrete slab or underneath the soil where subterranean termite colonies forage for food and water within 250 feet radius of your property. In effect, subterranean termites is excluded from any guarantees arranged for the fumigation work completed on your property.  uring fumigation and aeration, the possibility of burglary exists as it does any time you leave your home. Therefore, we recommend that you take steps that you feel necessary to prevent any damage to your property against any loss, break ins or vandalism to your property. This company does not provide any on site security except as required by state or local ordinances and does not assume any responsibility for care and custody of the property for the prevention of vandalism, or break ins. 

Certain areas may be inaccessible for inspection due to construction or storage. We recommend further inspection of areas where inspection was impractical. Re: Structural Pest Control Act, Article 6, section 8516 (b), paragraph 1990 (I). Amended effective March 1, 1974. Stall shower, if any, are water tested in compliance with Section 1991 (12) of the Structural Pest Control Act. The absence or presence of leaks through sub-floor, adjacent floors or walls will be reported. This is a report of the condition of the stall shower at the time of inspection only, and should not be confused as a guarantee. Although we make a visual examination, we do not deface or probe into window or door frames, decorative trim, roof members, etc., in search of wood destroying pests or organisms and perform tests to determine the "water tightness" of certain sections of the property being inspected.

title: Re Inspection Clause
description: This company will reinspect repairs done by others within four months of the original inspection. A charge, if any, can be no greater than the original inspection fee for each reinspection. The re inspection must be done within ten (10) working days of request. The reinspection is a visual inspection and if inspection of concealed areas is desired, inspection of work in progress will be necessary. Any guarantees must be received from parties performing repairs.

title: Plumbing Clause
description: NOTE: We do not inspect or certify plumbing, plumbing fixtures, and electrical. We do not inspect, test or certify the "water tightness" of the structure including, but not limited to - roofing, window frames, sky lights or door insulations.

title: Roof Clause
description: NOTE: The exterior surface of the roof was not inspected. If you want the water tightness of the roof determined, you should contract a roofing contractor who is licensed by the Contractor's State License Board.

title: Subcontract Profits
description: Because of licensing requirements, state and federal laws or the nature of the tasks involved, we may sub-contract work to others. The charge for service that this company subcontracts to another registered company may include the company's charges for arranging and administering such services that are in addition to the direct costs associated with paying the subcontractor. You may accept Avertapest's bid or you may contract directly with another company to perform the work. If you  hoose to contract directly with another company, Avertapest will not in any way be responsible for any act or omission in the performance of work that you directly contract with another to perform.

title: Second Opinion Disclosure
description: NOTICE: Reports on this structure prepared by various registered companies should list the same findings (i.e. termite infestations, termite damage, fungus damage, etc.). However, recommendations to correct these findings may vary from company to company. You have a right to seek a second opinion from another company.

title: Excludes Mold Clause
description: This Wood Destroying Pest & Organisms Report DOES NOT INCLUDE MOLD or any mold like conditions. No reference will be made to mold or mold-like conditions. Mold is not a Wood Destroying Organism and is outside the scope of this report as defined by the Structural Pest Control Act. If you wish your property to be inspected for mold or mold like conditions, please contact the appropriate mold professional.

title: Local Treatment Clause
description: Local treatment is not intended to be an entire structure treatment method. If infestations or wood-destroying pests extend or exist beyond the area(s) of local treatment, they may not be exterminated.

title: Pesticide Clause
description:
In accordance with the laws and regulation of the State of California, we are required to provide you with the following information prior to application of pesticides to your property.

"State law requires that you be given the following information: CAUTION--PESTICIDES ARE TOXIC CHEMICALS. Structural Pest Control Companies are registered and regulated by the Structural Pest Control Board, and apply pesticides which are registered and approved for use by the California Department of Pesticide Regulation and the United States Environmental Protection Agency. Registration is granted when the state finds that, based on existing scientific evidence, there are no appreciable risks if proper use conditions are followed or that the risks are outweighed by the benefits. The degree of risk depends upon the degree of exposure, so exposure should be minimized."

"If within 24 hours following application you experience symptoms similar to common seasonal illness comparable to the flu, contact your physician or poison control center (800) 876-4766 and your pest control company immediately."

For further information, contact any of the following:
Avertapest, Inc. (949) 338-3155
Poison Control Center (800) 876-4766
(Health Questions) County Health Dept.
Orange County (714) 834-4499

Riverside County (951) 358-5000
(Application Info.) County Agriculture Commission

Los Angeles County (626) 575-5466
San Bernardino County (909) 387-2115
Riverside County (951) 955-3045
Structural Pest Control Board (Regulatory Info.) (916) 561-8704
2005 Evergreen Street, Ste. 1500 Sacramento, CA 95815

title: Chemicals Used

title: Mechanic's Lien
description:
NOTICE TO OWNER

Under the California Mechanics Lien Law any structural pest control company which contracts to do work for you, any contractor, subcontractor, laborer, supplier or other person who helps to improve your property, but is not paid for his or her work or supplies, has a right to enforce a claim against your property. This means that after a court hearing, your property could be sold by a court officer and the proceeds of the sale used to satisfy the indebtedness. This can happen even if you have paid your structural pest control company in full if the subcontractor, laborers or suppliers remain unpaid.

To preserve their right to file a claim or lien against your property, certain claimants such as subcontractors or material suppliers are required to provide you with a document entitled "Preliminary Notice." Prime contractors and laborers for wages do not have to provide this notice. A Preliminary Notice is not a lien against your property. Its purpose is to notify you of persons who may have a right to file a lien against your property if they are not paid.

title: Payment Default
description: NOTE: If the Home Owner fails to pay billing in full, AVERTAPEST, INC. will have the right to be paid back for all its costs and expenses to the extent not prohibited by applicable law. Those expenses include, for example (but not limited to), reasonable attorney's fees. If for any reason this account is to be turned over to our collection agency, you will be responsible for all the cost of collecting.
